title: Excel Functions and Charts: Party Planning

steps.title: Basic Excel Functions
steps.content:
Essential Excel Functions

Download and use the Party planning file for these activities.

Create a new sheet named 'Functions Practice':

Functions: Quick Recap

Excel functions start with an equals sign (=) followed by the function name and data range.

  • SUM: Adds up numbers in a range
  • COUNTA: Counts cells that aren't empty
  • MAX: Finds the highest number
  • MIN: Finds the lowest number

Activity 1: Total Recipe Cost

Using the Party shopping list sheet, calculate the total cost of all items needed for the party. Copy your formula and result to your 'Functions Practice' sheet.

=SUM(F2:F6)

Activity 2: Recipe Analysis

Using Recipe ingredients, calculate the total quantities needed for each recipe (Choc-chip muffins, Blueberry muffins, Cupcakes). Copy your formulas and results to your 'Functions Practice' sheet.

quiz.question: Using the Party shopping list sheet, how would you calculate the total cost of all items?

steps.title: Using COUNTA for Ingredients
steps.content:
Tracking Ingredients

Create a new sheet named 'Ingredient Count':

Activity 1: Count Ingredients

Using Inside one cake, count how many unique ingredients we need. Copy your formula and result to your 'Ingredient Count' sheet.

=COUNTA(A2:A68)-7

We minus 7 because we don't want to include the actual recipe names among the ingredients.

Activity 2: Measurement Types

Count how many different measurement types (Measured in column) are used. Copy your formula and result to your 'Ingredient Count' sheet.

quiz.question: To count the number of ingredients for Blueberry Muffins in Inside one cake, which formula would you use?

steps.title: Using MAX and MIN Functions
steps.content:
Finding Cost Ranges

Create a new sheet named 'Cost Analysis':

Activity 1: Item Cost Range

Using the Party shopping list sheet, find the most and least expensive items (Price for one pack column). Copy your formulas and results to your 'Cost Analysis' sheet.

=MAX(C2:C6)

=MIN(C2:C6)

Activity 2: Servings Analysis

Find the highest and lowest number of servings per pack. Copy your formulas and results to your 'Cost Analysis' sheet.

quiz.question: Which function would you use to find the most expensive item in the Price for one pack column?

steps.title: Creating Visual Reports
steps.content:
Visualizing Recipe Data

Create a new sheet named 'Charts Practice':

Activity 1: Recipe Ingredients Chart

Using Recipe ingredients, create a bar chart comparing the number of ingredients needed for each recipe. Copy your chart to your 'Charts Practice' sheet.

  1. Use COUNTA to count the number of ingredients needed (e.g. =COUNTA(C2:C22) gives 8 ingredients for choc-chip muffins). Use autofill to do the other columns automatically.
  2. Copy and paste the header columns above the count values.
  3. Select the data (including the headers!) and go insert -> recommended chart.

Activity 2: Cost Distribution

Using the Party shopping list sheet, create a pie chart showing the cost distribution of different items. Copy your chart to your 'Charts Practice' sheet.

Submit Your Work

Once you've completed all exercises, your Excel file should contain these sheets:

  • Functions Practice
  • Ingredient Count
  • Cost Analysis
  • Charts Practice

Save your file and submit it to the Party Planning link under Course Outline.
